intro: Elaphrium cinereum, commonly known as the silverleaf elaphrium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking silver-green foliage. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, white to pale purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance, it is often cultivated in gardens across its native range.
